text: The EF 80–200mm lens is a discontinued telephoto zoom lens made by Canon. The lens has an EF lens mount that fits the EOS line of cameras. ==Versions== There are four versions: *2.8L lens (informally known as the "Magic Drainpipe") *4.5–5.6 lens *4.5–5.6 USM *4.5–5.6 II Canon released the 2.8L version in September 1989, retailing it for about US$1,320. Canon replaced it with the 70–200mm 2.8L in 1995. ==Table== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- !
